features.ai.name: AI Agents, Intact
features.ai.desc: Your desktop dev environment carries over as-is, so AI coding agents like Claude, Codex, and Gemini work right from your mobile.
features.host.name: Host Management
features.host.desc: Register and manage multiple dev servers. Supports both VS Code Tunnel and serve-web connection methods.
features.zero.name: Zero Install Connection
features.zero.desc: No extra software needed on your desktop. Connects via VS Code's built-in tunnel feature, with all authentication handled inside the app.
features.bio.name: Biometric App Lock
features.bio.desc: Protect your app with Face ID or Touch ID. Fine-tune lock timing for app launch, background return, and more.
features.siri.name: Siri Shortcuts
features.siri.desc: Say "Connect to PocketCode" to instantly reach your favorite host. Add shortcuts to your home screen for one-tap access.
features.conn.name: Connection Monitoring
features.conn.desc: Real-time network monitoring detects disconnections instantly. Unstable connections are automatically reconnected.
privacy.meta.title: Privacy Policy — PocketCode
privacy.meta.description: Privacy Policy for the PocketCode app
privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.highlight: PocketCode does not collect or transmit your personal data to external servers. All data is stored only on your device, and the app developer has no access to it.
privacy.s1.title: 1. Information We Process
privacy.s1.intro: PocketCode processes the following information only on your device to provide app functionality.
privacy.s1.item1: Host configuration — Name, address, port, and connection type of registered dev servers
privacy.s1.item2: Recent folders — Folder paths and last access times
privacy.s1.item3: Authentication data — GitHub or Microsoft account OAuth cookies (managed by WebKit)
privacy.s1.item4: Connection tokens — Access tokens for serve-web hosts (encrypted in iOS Keychain)
privacy.s1.item5: App lock settings — Biometric authentication preferences and lock timing
privacy.s2.title: 2. Where Data Is Stored
privacy.s2.intro: All data is stored on your device and is never transmitted to external servers.
privacy.s2.item3: WebKit storage — Auth cookies, VS Code editor cache
privacy.s3.title: 3. External Services
privacy.s3.intro: PocketCode connects directly to the following services. This is for core functionality, not for analytics or tracking.
privacy.s3.item4: User-registered dev servers — VS Code Tunnel or serve-web connections
privacy.s3.outro: PocketCode does not use any third-party analytics or crash reporting SDKs such as Firebase, Amplitude, or Sentry.
privacy.s4.title: 4. Biometric Authentication
privacy.s4.text: PocketCode may use Face ID or Touch ID for app lock. Biometric data is processed by iOS; PocketCode does not store or access biometric information directly. Only the authentication result (success or failure) is checked within the app.
privacy.s5.title: 5. Information We Do Not Collect
privacy.s5.intro: PocketCode does not collect the following information.
privacy.s5.item5: Content of code you write or edit
privacy.s5.item6: Device usage patterns or behavioral analytics
privacy.s6.title: 6. Data Deletion
privacy.s6.intro: You can delete your data at any time within the app.
privacy.s6.item1: Delete host — Removes host configuration, connection tokens, and recent folder history.
privacy.s6.item2: Sign out — Removes GitHub or Microsoft authentication cookies.
privacy.s6.item3: Clear cache — Clear WebKit cache from settings.
privacy.s6.item4: Delete app — Uninstalling the app removes all data completely from your device.
privacy.s7.title: 7. Children's Privacy
privacy.s7.text: PocketCode does not intentionally collect personal information from children under 14.
privacy.s8.title: 8. Changes
privacy.s8.text: This privacy policy may be updated as needed. Changes will be posted on this page with an updated effective date.
privacy.s9.title: 9. Contact
privacy.s9.text: If you have questions about this privacy policy, please contact us via GitHub.
